message.content:
cs.HC, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a virtual reality environment and a real-time experimental protocol to study the four main dynamic factors in sEMG-based gesture recognition. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) sub-category. The paper also proposes a new transfer learning-based algorithm for long term gesture classification, which suggests that it may also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The use of the leap motion camera for gesture recognition feedback suggests that the paper may also belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The study involves the use of a virtual reality environment, which suggests that it may also belong to the Robotics (cs.RO) sub-category. Finally, the use of transfer learning and neural networks suggests that the paper may also belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category.
